November 13, 1939.
Mr. Frank E. Schooley,
Executive Secretary,
University of Illinois,
UrLana, Illinois.
My dear Frank:
I was a little disturbed about your November 8th
letter. Lemmon promised to take care of it that same day.
I spoke to him about it a few days ago. I hope it»s cleared
up by this time.
Not a word from Wadiington about the hearing,
but I have an idea that our chances are 50-50.
MSH/cb
NEW YORK
WORLD'S FAIR 1939
‘New York City's Own Station”—810 Kc.
